frameDefinitions: AForgoer decides not to partake in something ordinary that is otherwise Desirable.
An Asset is in a state where it is exposed to or otherwise liable to be affected by a Harmful_event, which may be metonymically evoked by reference to a Dangerous_entity.
A Device or machine is put in (or out of) service either by a volitional Agent or by a Cause event or force acting on the Device.
A Protagonist is sensitive to a Trigger, which has the potential to cause some kind of reaction in the Protagonist.  '' 'Mr. Clinton and his wife Hillary are allergic to cats.'
An Earner receives Earnings by providing Goods to a Buyer; providing the Goods also generally entails a cost, which may or may not be included in the consideration.

This frame concerns an Addict's physiological or psychological compulsive dependence on an Addictant, the substance or behavior to which the Addict is addicted. '' 'Although she was never a big fan of drugs, she became hooked on that designer drug instantly.'
frameExamples: If you are a farmer, you are at <t>risk</t> for hearing loss caused by noise exposure in your work.
The laborer realized that he <t>activated</t> the machine but did not know how to stop it.
Mr. Clinton and his wife Hillary are <t>allergic</t> to cats.
This reflects the 15 % jump in <t><fex name='Earnings'>earnings</fex></t> over 1994 .
Although she was never a big fan of drugs, she became <t>hooked</t> on that designer drug instantly.
listRoleDefinitions: The <fen>Forgoer</fen> decides not to partake in the desirable activity or event.
<fen>Desirable</fen> identifies the event or activity in which is the <fen>Forgoer</fen> does not partake.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> at which the the forgoing occurs.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the forgoing occurs.
Something judged to be desirable or valuable which might be lost or damaged.
An action that may occur or a state which may hold which could result in the loss of or damage to the <fen>Asset</fen>.
A concrete or abstract entity which may come to cause the loss of, or damage to the <fen>Asset</fen> either due to its participation in a <fen>Harmful_event</fen>.
The time period during which the <fen>Asset</fen> enjoys  the specified level of security from a <fen>Harmful_event</fen>.

A particular location in which the <fen>Asset</fen> is secure. Frequently, it is to be inferred that the characteristics of the location protect the <fen>Asset</fen> from a potential <fen>Harmful_event</fen>.
The <fen>Device</fen> or machine that is in or out of operation.
The <fen>Agent</fen> is the person who changes the operational state of the <fen>Device</fen>.
<fen>Cause</fen> identifies the non-agentive force that causes the <fen>Device</fen> to begin to operate.
The <fen>Time</fen> when a <fen>Device</fen> is put into or out of operation.
The <fen>Place</fen> in which the <fen>Device</fen> is put into or out of operation.
The <fen>Protagonist</fen> occurs as the External Argument of the targets in this frame. The <fen>Protagonist</fen> represents the one exhibiting the response to the <fen>Trigger</fen>.

The <fen>Trigger</fen> most commonly occurs in a PP Complement headed by <ment>to</ment>. The <fen>Trigger</fen> is that substance or element which causes a health response in the <fen>Protagonist</fen>.
The <fen>Earner</fen> is involved in a transaction or set of transactions as the party that receives payment.
<fen>Earnings</fen> are the money given to the <fen>Earner</fen> in a transaction, generally in exchange for <fen>Goods</fen>.
The time when the <fen>Earner</fen> makes their <fen>Earnings</fen>.
The location where the <fen>Earner</fen> makes their <fen>Earnings</fen>.
The <fen>Addict</fen> is physiologically or psychologically dependent on a substance or a behavior.
<fen>Addictant</fen> is the substance or behavior to which the <fen>Addict</fen> is dependent.
listRoleExamples: There is a locked padlock that guarantees <fex>the information</fex> is secure.
Our system ensures that information stored within hardware is secure <fex>from external software attack and physical theft</fex>.
We make sure your BMW is secure <fex>against intruders</fex>.

Israel is insecure <fex>today</fex> not because it does
not have enough military power.
Workers need to make sure their property is secure <fex>at work</fex>.
<fex>The night lights</fex> were turned on in the secondary school.
Instantly <fex>Sue</fex> activated the commlink on the wall.
He was in his stocking feet while standing in the bayou that formed when <fex>the wind</fex> turned the shower on in that one upstairs bathroom.
My dad turned the lights on for me <fex>at 10 o'clock</fex>
Suddenly, the lights got turned on <fex>on the Jamaica road bridge</fex>.
<fex>Pat's</fex> allergy to dairy products is severe.
Some people are very sensitive <fex>to chemicals in the environment</fex>.
She made a lot of money <fex>in Africa</fex> .
